The sinner may become a child of God, an heir of heaven. He may rise from the dust, and stand forth arrayed in garments of light. Transformed by beholding Jesus, he becomes a partaker of the divine nature. . . . We must behold Jesus by faith as an ever-present help in time of need.--Ms 20, 1892, pp. 1, 33-35, 37-40. (Diary, 1892.)
